meanings.definition: Filks (verb): to write and perform a parody of a popular song with humorous or satirical lyrics.
meanings.sent1: She filks her favorite songs to make her friends laugh.
meanings.sent2: They filks the latest hit song at the talent show.
meanings.sent3: The comedian filks a famous tune to poke fun at current events.
meanings.sent4: His clever filks on well-known melodies always get the audience chuckling.
meanings.sent5: Filking old classics gives a fresh twist to familiar tunes.

meanings.definition: Filks (noun): songs written and performed by fans of science fiction and fantasy, often parodying popular songs.
meanings.sent1: The convention featured a lively filks session with fans singing their favorite tunes.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys listening to filks inspired by her favorite fantasy novels.
meanings.sent3: The filks competition at the event had everyone tapping their feet.
meanings.sent4: The album is a collection of imaginative filks that transport listeners to other worlds.
meanings.sent5: Fans gather around the campfire to share their latest filks creations.
